H-1B Specialty Occupations Requirements

Required Steps for H-1B Application

Step 1: Labor Condition Application (LCA)

Employer must file Form ETA-9035 with the Department of Labor.

  • Determine prevailing wage
  • Post LCA notice at worksite
  • Obtain DOL certification

Step 2: File Form I-129

Employer files Petition for Nonimmigrant Worker with USCIS.

  • Include supporting documentation
  • Pay required fees ($460 base + $500 fraud prevention)
  • Include premium processing fee if desired ($2,805)

Step 3: Consular Processing (if outside U.S.)

Apply for H-1B visa at U.S. consulate or embassy.

  • Complete DS-160 form
  • Pay visa application fee ($205)
  • Schedule consular interview
  • Attend interview with required documents

Step 4: Medical Examination (Country-Specific)

Complete medical examination with authorized panel physician in country of residence.

  • Schedule appointment with panel physician
  • Complete required vaccinations
  • Undergo physical examination
  • Pay medical examination fees

Step 5: Document Preparation

Gather all required supporting documents.

  • Educational credentials and evaluations
  • Employment offer letter
  • Specialty occupation evidence
  • Passport and photographs

Step 6: Visa Interview

Attend consular interview and provide biometrics.

  • Answer questions about employment and qualifications
  • Present all required documentation
  • Provide fingerprints and photograph

Important Notes

  • H-1B cap may apply (65,000 regular + 20,000 advanced degree)
  • Processing times vary by service center and workload
  • Premium processing available for faster adjudication
  • Medical examination requirements vary by country of residence

Fee Schedule

I-129 Filing Fee$460
Fraud Prevention Fee$500
Premium Processing$2,805
Visa Application Fee$205
Medical ExaminationVaries by country

Source: USCIS Official Guidelines
